name: Backcountry Camping in Lassen's Wilderness
description: Overnight trips are allowed in the park’s backcountry year-round. There are no designated or official campsites, and no amenities like tent pads or picnic tables. There are areas closed to camping (see regulations for details). A wilderness permit is required for all overnight stays in the park outside of established campgrounds. Permits may only be obtained prior to your visit online at recreation.gov. In winter, backcountry camping is allowed on /near the main park road when it is closed due to snow.

accessibility.wheelchairAccess: There are no ADA accessible trails or facilities in Lassen's backcountry. Trails are unpaved, uneven, and may have obstacles like fallen trees and debris along them. Trails may not be wide enough to accommodate wheelchairs. Backcountry campsites are not established and may be uneven or have obstacles. Power-Driven Mobility Devices (OPDMDs) are not allowed in wilderness areas.
accessibility.fireStovePolicy: Only small, liquid or gas fuel stoves are allowed in the backcountry / wilderness. Fires are not allowed in the backcountry / wilderness.
accessibility.rvInfo: RVs and trailers are not allowed in Lassen's backcountry.
accessibility.additionalInfo: Restrooms, a camper store, cell service, and internet connectivity may be available in the park's front country. There are no services or amenities in the backcountry.
accessibility.adaInfo: Lassen's backcountry/wilderness areas have primitive trails, no amenities, and no services. Trails are unpaved, uneven, and may have obstacles like fallen trees and debris along them. Backcountry campsites at Lassen are uneven and offer no services like restrooms, firepits, or picnic tables. Backcountry areas range in elevation. Power-Driven Mobility Devices (OPDMDs) are not allowed in wilderness areas.

emailAddresses.description: Lassen's main email contact for visitor questions, comments, and concerns. Please allow a few days for response, as staff availability varies.

fees.description: Per-permit, nonrefundable administrative fee. This fee is automatically added to your wilderness permit reservation on recreation.gov. Only one wilderness permit is required per trip, regardless of how many nights or zones you travel.
fees.title: Wilderness Permit Administrative Fee

fees.description: One-time fee charged for each person on your trip (backcountry camping groups are limited to 10 people maximum). Total fee will automatically calculate based on trip information you provide when reserving your Wilderness Permit on recreation.gov. There is no per-night fee for Wilderness Permits / backcountry camping, only an administrative fee ($6/permit) and this per-person fee. Please only reserve one Wilderness Permit per trip.
fees.title: Wilderness Permit Per-Trip, Per-Person Fee

images.title: Backpackers On Trail
images.altText: Two backpackers walking away from camera on a trail through the forest
images.caption: Backpacking is allowed year-round, but is most popular in the summer months when snow has fully melted.

images.title: Backcountry Camping Zones and Closed Areas
images.altText: map of Lassen Volcanic National Park overlayed with numbered zones and areas closed to camping.
images.caption: Wilderness permits require trip location information based on these designated zones. Areas in red are closed to backcountry camping.

name: Butte Lake Campground
description: Butte Lake Campground is located in the NE corner of Lassen Volcanic National Park. The campground is a 45-minute drive from the Northwest Entrance and Manzanita Lake Area and is accessed via the 6-mile-long Butte Lake Road south of highway 44. This remote campground offers few amenities, but numerous recreation opportunities. Enjoy a hike up Cinder Cone or a paddle along Butte Lake's lava rock shores. Reservations are required.

accessibility.cellPhoneInfo: Nearest cell service is on Highway 44.
accessibility.fireStovePolicy: Fires allowed in provided fire rings only. Stoves permitted.
accessRoads: Unpaved Roads - All vehicles OK in good weather

emailAddresses.description: General email address for camping information.

fees.description: Rate per campsite.
fees.title: Campsite

fees.description: Single campsite when water is not available (early and late season).
fees.title: Campsite (water off)

fees.description: Campsite for a minimum of 10 and a maximum of 25 people and up to six licensed vehicles or one bus/RV.
fees.title: Group Campsite

fees.description: Group campsite when water is unavailable (early and late season).
fees.title: Group (water off)

fees.description: The Butte Lake stock corral is located north of the campground via a short access road and is available by reservation only.
fees.title: Stock corral

images.title: Butte Lake boat launch
images.altText: A sandy boat launch area on the edge of a conifer-lined lake.
images.caption: The campground is a short walk from the Butte Lake boat launch.

images.caption: Butte Lake Campground contains two loops located near Butte Lake.

name: Juniper Lake Campground
description: The Juniper Lake Campground is located on the east shore of Juniper Lake via a 13-mile paved/gravel road. All single campsites are first-come, first-served only. Reservations are required for the two group sites and one stock corral. Drinking water is not available.

accessibility.wheelchairAccess: Sites are mostly flat and may be accessible by a wheelchairs. Vault toilets are accessible.
accessibility.cellPhoneInfo: No cell phone service. Nearest signal is approximately 5 miles on the road toward Chester.
accessibility.fireStovePolicy: Do not cut, saw, or break any standing trees, dead or alive for firewood. You may gather dead wood that is down on the ground within 30 feet of the road and less than 4 inches in diameter. Chainsaw use is not permitted. Fires are allowed only in designated fire grates. Do not build rock rings or burn trash in the grate. Never leave fires or hot coals unattended and extinguish them completely before leaving.
accessibility.rvInfo: RVs and trailers are not advised due to steep, rutted, dirt access road.
accessibility.additionalInfo: The are no services in the Juniper Lake Area. Services and supplies are available in Chester.
accessRoads: Unpaved Roads - All vehicles OK in good weather

emailAddresses.description: Email address for general camping information.

fees.description: First-come, first-served campsite. Each campsite is equipped with a picnic table, fire grate, bearproof box, and parking area. Electric and water hookups are not available. Vehicles must stay on paved/graveled areas. No water is available in the campground.
fees.title: Campsite

fees.description: Tent camping only. Group site capacity is limited to a minimum of 10, and a maximum of 15 people, and up to six licensed vehicles. Each group campsite is equipped with three picnic tables, three fire grates, three metal food lockers, and a parking area. No water is available in the campground.
fees.title: Group Campsite

fees.description: Two metal panel corrals. Only one stock party is assigned to the site at one time. Group site capacity is limited to a maximum of 10 people, 8 animals, and 4 licensed vehicles, which include trailers. Stock parties must camp at the corral campsite. Hitch rails are not provided. Portable corrals are not allowed except within designated corral enclosure areas.
fees.title: Stock Corral

images.title: Juniper Lake Group Site
images.altText: Trash receptacles and picnic tables amid conifer trees on the edge of a mountain lake.
images.caption: Two group sites are located off a spur of the campground road.

images.caption: Campsites on southern side of the campground road have meadow views.

images.caption: Juniper Lake Campground is located adjacent to Juniper Lake.

images.caption: Many sites are adjacent to Juniper Lake

images.title: Campsite
images.altText: A picnic table in conifer trees near the grassy shore of a mountain lake.
images.caption: Juniper Lake Campground is on the eastern shore of Juniper Lake.

images.title: Evening at Juniper Lake Campground
images.altText: A photo of a kayak and row boat on the short of a moonlit, mountain lake.
images.caption: Campers can launch boats from Juniper Lake Campground.

name: Lost Creek Group Campground
description: Lost Creek Group Campground contains only group campsites. All sites are reservation-only. The campground is located five miles south of Manzanita Lake on the park highway. The campground offers easy access to Manzanita Lake, Devastated, and Summit Lake Areas.

accessibility.wheelchairAccess: Site are mostly flat and may be accessed by wheelchair. Vault toilets are wheelchair accessible.
accessibility.cellPhoneInfo: No cell service. Nearest signal is four miles away at the Chaos Jumbles pullout.
accessibility.fireStovePolicy: Do not cut, saw, or break any standing trees, dead or alive for firewood. You may gather dead wood that is down on the ground within 30 feet of the road and less than 4 inches in diameter. Chainsaw use is not permitted. Fires are allowed only in designated fire grates. Do not build rock rings or burn trash in the grate. Never leave fires or hot coals unattended and extinguish them completely before leaving.
accessibility.rvInfo: RVs and trailers are allowed in all sites.
accessibility.additionalInfo: Services including a dump station, showers, laundry, are available at the Manzanita Lake Camper Store, five miles away.

emailAddresses.description: Email address for general camping information.

fees.description: Group campsite capacity is limited to a minimum of 10, a maximum of 25 people, and up to 6 vehicles or one bus/RV. Each group campsite is equipped with three picnic tables, three fire grates, three metal food lockers, and a parking area.
fees.title: Group campsite

images.title: Lost Creek campsite
images.altText: A large picnic tent next to two picnic tables with camping chairs and three brown metal bear boxes.
images.caption: Each campsite includes three food lockers, picnic tables, and fire grates.

images.title: Lost Creek Group Campground Map
images.altText: A map of an oval loop with 8 campsites.
images.caption: Lost Creek Campground contains only group sites.

name: Manzanita Lake Campground
description: Manzanita Lake is the largest campground in the park. Located next to Manzanita Lake near the park's northwest entrance, campers can easily enjoy swimming, fishing, kayaking, and hiking. This campground tends to have the longest open season in the park and includes tent sites, car/vehicle camping sites, and group campsites. Manzanita Lake is an NPS-managed campground; concession concession-managed glamping tents and cabins are located nearby.

accessibility.wheelchairAccess: Accessible cabins include a ramp, wheel-chair accessible picnic table, and rigid ground surface outside the cabin. The Manzanita Lake Camper Store offers an accessible shower stall with a bench seat and hand rails.
accessibility.internetInfo: No Internet access available in the Manzanita Lake Area. Free WiFi is available inside the Kohm Yah-mah-nee Visitor Center, 30 miles south.
accessibility.cellPhoneInfo: Cell service is extremely limited in the campground. Nearest reliable cell service is located two miles away at Chaos Crags pullout on the park highway.
accessibility.fireStovePolicy: Do not cut, saw, or break any standing trees, dead or alive for firewood. You may gather dead wood that is down on the ground within 30 feet of the road and less than 4 inches in diameter. Chainsaw use is not permitted. Fires are allowed only in designated fire grates. Do not build rock rings or burn trash in the grate. Never leave fires or hot coals unattended and extinguish them completely before leaving.
accessibility.rvInfo: Some sites offer pull-through parking that can accommodate RVs up to 40 feet in length.
accessibility.additionalInfo: Dump station is located on road to campground. Camper Store is located at entrance of the campground.
accessibility.adaInfo: Campsites B-9 and A-32 are accessible. Camping cabins 1, 8, 14, and 18 are accessible.

emailAddresses.description: Email address for general camping information

fees.description: Single campsite for a maximum of 3 tents, 6 people, and 2 vehicles (including RVs).
fees.title: Campsite

fees.description: Single campsite when water is not available. Limited to a maximum of 3 tents, 6 people, and 2 vehicles (including RVs).
fees.title: Campsite (water off)

fees.description: Group site joining two or more adjacent campsites (B20-22, B24-27, B28-30, B31-32, B33-34). Limited to 10-25 people and 6 vehicles (including RVs).
fees.title: Group campsite

fees.description: One-room rustic camping cabin available by reservation only. All cabins include bed(s), propane heater, battery-powered lantern, bear proof food storage box, fire ring, and picnic table. Central restrooms and showers are located nearby. Both shower areas have an ADA accessible stall with bench seat and hand rails. ADA accessible cabins with ramps are also available. The mattress provided are 3 inches and firm so we encourage you to bring additional bedding; sleeping bags, comforters and blankets.
fees.title: One-room camping cabin

fees.description: Two-room rustic camping cabin available by reservation only. All cabins include bed(s), propane heater, battery-powered lantern, bear proof food storage box, fire ring, and picnic table. Central restrooms and showers are located nearby. Both shower areas have an ADA accessible stall with bench seat and hand rails. ADA accessible cabins with ramps are also available. The mattress provided are 3 inches and firm so we encourage you to bring additional bedding; sleeping bags, comforters and blankets.
fees.title: Two-room camping cabin

fees.description: Bunkhouse rustic camping cabin available by reservation only. All cabins include bed(s), propane heater, battery-powered lantern, bear proof food storage box, fire ring, and picnic table. Central restrooms and showers are located nearby. Both shower areas have an ADA accessible stall with bench seat and hand rails. ADA accessible cabins with ramps are also available. The mattress provided are 3 inches and firm so we encourage you to bring additional bedding; sleeping bags, comforters and blankets.
fees.title: Bunkhouse camping cabin

images.altText: A paved road lined by campsites containing trailers and vehicles.
images.caption: A limited number of campsites can accommodate RVs and trailers.

images.caption: Group campsites combine two or three adjacent single sites.

name: Southwest Campground - Summer/Fall
description: The Southwest Walk-in Campground is located on the east side of the Kohm Yah-mah-nee Visitor Center parking area. A short walk along a paved walkway provides easy access to each site. This campground also includes 15 parking lot sites. Regulations and the walk-in camping area change when snow is on the ground, approximately November to May.

accessibility.wheelchairAccess: Walk-in tent sites are not wheelchair accessible; they are accessed via uneven gravel path from parking area. Self-contained vehicle sites are located on a flat, paved parking lot. Campground restroom/water facilities and Kohm Yah-mah-nee Visitor Center from parking lot is wheelchair accessible.
accessibility.internetInfo: Free WiFi is located inside the adjacent Kohm Yah-mah-nee Visitor Center. WiFi is available in the visitor center lobby after business hours.
accessibility.cellPhoneInfo: Cell service is extremely limited and typically nonexistent in this area.
accessibility.fireStovePolicy: Self-contained barbecues are allowed in the paved parking area. Do not cut, saw, or break any standing trees, dead or alive for firewood. You may gather dead wood that is down on the ground within 30 feet of the road and less than 4 inches in diameter. Chainsaw use is not permitted. Fires are allowed only in designated fire grates. Do not build rock rings or burn trash in the grate. Never leave fires or hot coals unattended and extinguish them completely before leaving.
accessibility.rvInfo: 20 sites are walk-in tent sites only. 5 sites may accommodate RVs and trailers or other self-contained vehicles.
accessibility.additionalInfo: Flush toilets and an industrial sink area located in the campground restroom facility, which is available in the warmer summer/fall months. Flush toilets, sinks, and a water bottle filling station are available inside the 24-hour vestibule of the adjacent visitor center. Staff in the adjacent entrance station and visitor center are available to assist campers when open.
accessibility.adaInfo: No walk-in tent sites meet ADA standards. Tent sites located nearest the restroom are also closest to the parking area and are easiest to access. Self-contained vehicle sites are located on a flat, paved parking lot. There are no dedicated sidewalks to vehicle sites. Access to campground restroom/water facilities and Kohm Yah-mah-nee Visitor Center from parking lot meet ADA standards.

emailAddresses.description: Email address for general camping information.

fees.description: Single walk-in campsite limited to a maximum of 2 tents, 6 people, and 2 vehicles.
fees.title: Walk-in Tent Site

fees.description: Camping in a self-contained vehicle in the adjacent parking area only. Please park between islands.
fees.title: Self-Contained Vehicle Site

images.title: Campsite
images.altText: A green tent, two blue chairs, and a brown bear box
images.caption: All campsites are accessed by a short walk from the parking area.

images.title: Restroom and Summer/Fall Registration
images.altText: Two people walk along a paved pathway toward a small brown building.
images.caption: A registration area and restroom are available in the summer and fall seasons.

images.title: Kohm Yah-mah-nee Visitor Center Parking Area

images.caption: The campground is adjacent to the Kohm Yah-mah-nee Visitor Center parking area.

images.altText: A map of the campground indicating sites of a walkway to the right of a large parking area.

images.title: Winter Map
images.altText: A map of a parking area, campground, and visitor center indicating closures and routes for snow.
images.caption: Oversnow tent camping is located south of the parking area in the winter months, approximately November through May.

name: Southwest Campground - Winter/Spring
description: The Southwest Walk-in Campground is located on the east side of the Kohm Yah-mah-nee Visitor Center parking area. When snow is present, approximately November to May, overnight stays are only allowed in self-contained vehicles in the parking lot (walk-in tent sites are closed in winter). Regulations change and the walk-in tent sites are open when the snow melts, approximately June to October.

accessibility.wheelchairAccess: All parking spaces are paved and flat. Sidewalks around parking area and to Kohm Yah-mah-nee Visitor Center are ACA accessible.
accessibility.internetInfo: Kohm Yah-mah-nee Visitor Center offers free public Wi-Fi inside the building.
accessibility.fireStovePolicy: Self-contained barbecues and gas stoves are allowed in the paved parking area. Fires and fire pans, including portable gas fire pits, are prohibited
accessibility.rvInfo: Self-contained vehicles are allowed to camp overnight in parking lot sites. Please use one space per vehicle (or two spaces for longer rigs, but vehicles that extend beyond the width of the parking area and block flow of traffic are not allowed).
accessibility.additionalInfo: All amenities are available at the Kohm Yah-mah-nee Visitor Center; there are no restrooms or water immediately located at the parking spaces. When the visitor center is closed, restrooms and water are still available in a 24-hour vestibule at the front doors.
accessibility.adaInfo: All parking spaces are paved and flat. Sidewalks to access facilities are ADA accessible.

emailAddresses.description: Email address for questions related to park fees, campgrounds, and camping.

fees.description: Camping in a self-contained vehicle in the adjacent parking area only. Please park between islands to allow for plowing activities.
fees.title: Self-Contained Vehicle Site

images.title: Southwest Parking Area in Winter
images.altText: plowed parking lot with a few vehicles surrounded by deep snow, pine trees, and mountains
images.caption: The parking area is typically plowed in winter; overnight stays are allowed year-round.

images.title: Southwest Parking Area in Summer
images.altText: large parking lot with vehicles among pine trees, mountains behind
images.caption: The center section of the parking lot, between two medians, may be used to camp overnight in self-contained vehicles.

images.title: Southwest Area Self-Contained Camping Map
images.altText: map depicting designated area for self-contained camping in the visitor center parking lot.
images.caption: Overnight stays are only allowed in a portion of the parking lot shown on the map.

name: Summit Lake North Campground
description: Summit Lake North Campground is located on the north side of Summit Lake at about the middle point of the 30-mile park highway. The campground includes loop A and B. Additional campsites are located in three loops on the south side of the lake in Summit Lake South Campground. A picnic area is located on the shore and features a swimming area, picnic tables, and day use parking.

accessibility.internetInfo: No Internt service in this area.
accessibility.cellPhoneInfo: Cell service is extremely limited in the area.
accessibility.fireStovePolicy: Do not cut, saw, or break any standing trees, dead or alive for firewood. You may gather dead wood that is down on the ground within 30 feet of the road and less than 4 inches in diameter. Chainsaw use is not permitted. Fires are allowed only in designated fire grates. Do not build rock rings or burn trash in the grate. Never leave fires or hot coals unattended and extinguish them completely before leaving.

emailAddresses.description: Email address for general camping information.

fees.description: Single campsite for a maximum of 3 tents, 6 people, and 2 vehicles (including RVs).
fees.title: Campsite

fees.description: The Summit Lake horse corral is located across the highway and is available by reservation only.
fees.title: Horse corral

images.title: Summit Lake North Campsite
images.altText: Two tents, two chairs, and a picnic table at a campsite in trees with a restroom to the right.
images.caption: A campsite at Summit Lake North Campground.

images.caption: Swimming is popular on the north shore of Summit Lake.

images.altText: A map of a campground with two side-by-side loops A and B and a day use area on the shore of lake.
images.caption: Summit Lake North includes a picnic area on the lakeshore.

name: Summit Lake South Campground
description: Summit Lake South Campground is located on the south side of Summit Lake at about the middle point of the 30-mile park highway. The campground contains loops C, D, and E (tents only). Additional campsites are located in two loops on the north side of the lake in Summit Lake North Campground.

accessibility.wheelchairAccess: There are no ADA sites in Summit Lake Campground. A-1 in Summit Lake North is accessible. All restrooms are wheelchair accessible.
accessibility.fireStovePolicy: Do not cut, saw, or break any standing trees, dead or alive for firewood. You may gather dead wood that is down on the ground within 30 feet of the road and less than 4 inches in diameter. Chainsaw use is not permitted. Fires are allowed only in designated fire grates. Do not build rock rings or burn trash in the grate. Never leave fires or hot coals unattended and extinguish them completely before leaving.
accessibility.rvInfo: No trailer or RVs in Summit Lake South Campground due to lake of space and small parking area. Small tent trailers are okay.
accessibility.additionalInfo: Campground host is located approximately 1/2 mile north at the Summit Lake Trailhead.
accessibility.adaInfo: There are no ADA sites in Summit Lake Campground. A-1 in Summit Lake North is accessible.

emailAddresses.description: Email address for general camping information.

fees.description: Single campsite for a maximum of 3 tents, 6 people, and 2 vehicles (including RVs).
fees.title: Campsite

fees.description: Single campsite when water is unavailable. Limited to 3 tents, 6 people, and 2 vehicles (including RVs).
fees.title: Campsite (water off)

images.altText: A tree-lined campsite with a tent and metal bear box .
images.caption: Some campsites backup to meadow areas.

name: Warner Valley Campground
description: Warner Valley is managed by park concessionaire Snow Mountain, LLC; please visit lassenlodging.com/warner-campground/ to learn more about this campground. This 17-site primitive campground is nestled at the base of a steep mountainside amid conifer trees; access via gravel road. Trailers and RVs are not recommended.

accessibility.wheelchairAccess: There are no ADA sites. Most sites are flat and are accessible by wheelchairs. Restrooms are wheelchair-accessible.
accessibility.cellPhoneInfo: No cell service. Limited service is available at the park entrance.
accessibility.fireStovePolicy: Do not cut, saw, or break any standing trees, dead or alive for firewood. You may gather dead wood that is down on the ground within 30 feet of the road and less than 4 inches in diameter. Chainsaw use is not permitted. Fires are allowed only in designated fire grates. Do not build rock rings or burn trash in the grate. Never leave fires or hot coals unattended and extinguish them completely before leaving.
accessibility.rvInfo: RVs and trailers not recommended due to steep, rutted gravel access road.
accessibility.additionalInfo: The nearby Drakesbad Guest Ranch offers dining, horseback riding, massage, and thermal pool swimming. Call ahead for reservations. Warner Valley Campground is operated by the park concessioner Snow Mountain, LLC. The nearest supplies and services are located in Chester.
accessRoads: Unpaved Roads - All vehicles OK in good weather

emailAddresses.description: Email address for general camping information.

fees.description: Single campsite for a maximum of 3 tents, 6 people, and 2 vehicles (including RVs).
fees.title: Campsite

images.title: Warner Valley Campground Map
images.altText: A map showing a campground along a spur road with 18 sites.
images.caption: This small campground is perched on at the base of Flatiron Ridge.
